TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridItemCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
type DataGridItemCollection = class interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> objects, which in turn represent the data items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. To programmatically retrieve <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> objects from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, use one of following methods:
- Use the indexer to get a single <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object from the collection, using array notation.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the collection to a <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=nameWithType>, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection.Count%2A> property specifies the total number of items in the collection and is commonly used to determine the upper bound of the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to iterate through <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection.
[!code-aspx-csharp[DataGridColumnVisible#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridColumnVisible/CS/datagridcolumnvisiblecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DataGridColumnVisible#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridColumnVisible/VB/datagridcolumnvisiblevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Copies all the items from this collection to the specified , starting at the specified index in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=nameWithType>, starting at the specified index.
> [!NOTE] > The `array` parameter must be a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of objects in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of objects in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection.Count%2A> property to determine the number of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection.Count%2A> property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed
abstract member GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator override this.GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator

Docs.summary: Returns a -implemented object that contains all the objects in the collection.
Docs.returns: A -implemented object that contains all objects in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType>-implemented object that can be iterated through to get each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to move the enumerator to its initial position.
> [!NOTE] > After you create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType>-implemented object or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is undefined.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsReadOnly As Boolean
public: property bool IsReadOnly { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the objects in the collection can be modified.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection can be written to in all cases.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean
public: property bool IsSynchronized { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread-safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is derived from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface and is overridden to always return `false`.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets the object at the specified index in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection at the specified index, using array notation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SyncRoot As Object
public: property System::Object ^ SyncRoot { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: A that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> object itself.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface.
